title: The Twins
marks: Signature and Date LL in black oil: [DALE NICHOLS 1946]
text:
Dale Nichols' idyllic images of rural mid-western life are rooted in the artist's experiences as a boy growing up in Nebraska. His compositions are distillations of essential elements to which he imparted a sculptural quality through abstraction and simplification of forms - much in a manner that suggests the influence of the regionalist artist, Grant Wood.

In <i>The Twins<i>, the composition is dominated by two leafless trees that give the painting its title. Abstracted natural forms and crisp edges imbue this nostalgic view of farm life with a visual lucidity reminiscent of a dreamlike state.
description: landscape. farmhouse at right center road vanishes from front center to left side of canvas; at left center, a farmer drives his horse-drawn cart under one of a pair of leafless trees standing in front of the house
creditline: Gift of Rev. Richard L. Hillstrom in memory of Marion Gustafson Lindquist
